definitions: undo the lock of (something) by using a key

examples.text: he unlocked the door to his room

definitions: make (something previously inaccessible or unexploited) available for use

examples.text: the campaign has helped us unlock rich reserves of talent among our employees

shortDefinitions: make something previously inaccessible or unexploited available for use

definitions: use a password or other form of authentication to access the full functionality or data of (a computer, mobile phone, file, etc.)

examples.text: when you unlock your phone, you're presented with the ‘home screen’—the interface that shows off all your apps

shortDefinitions: use password etc. to access full functionality of computer etc.

definitions: make (a mobile phone) capable of operating on the network of any chosen carrier

examples.text: you cannot unlock your phone while you are under contract

shortDefinitions: make mobile phone capable of operating on any network
